X.T: Bluedot.tech
Les cépages
FassadenGrün
César Milstein - My Favourite Scientist

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says all.

X.T: New Algorithms Force Scientists to Revise the Tree of Life

ARTICLE.COMMENT: New algorithms determinate the genes carrying the most information to build the phylogenetic tree.

X.T: Weird Places: Movile Cave

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A cave has been isolated from outside for 5.5 millions years, a special ecosystem evolved in it.

X.T: [Maxime Hervé] L'évolution des espèces : mais d'où sort vraiment cette idée ?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A good history of the discovery of evolution.

X.T: How Apple Flies Changed the Way We Think of Evolution

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Allopatric vs sympatric speciation.

X.T: Why Do Taxonomists Write the Meanest Obituaries?
X.ST: The open nature of the science of classification virtually guarantees fights.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The way taxonomists manage their science means they have to tediously clean-up the mess of some incompetent ones.

X.T: [Marc-André Selosse] Voyage au pays des microbes

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The relationships of fungus and bacteria with plants and animals.

X.T: [Catherine Jessus] Étonnant vivant

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A good simple presentation of some biology discoveries done during the last 15 years.

X.T: Fossil Discoveries Challenge Ideas About Earth’s Start
X.ST: A series of fossil finds suggests that life on Earth started earlier than anyone thought, calling into question a widely held theory of the solar system’s beginnings.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The subtitle says all.

X.T: Il n'y a pas que les gènes dans la vie ! L'épigénétique, avec P'tite Jane — Science étonnante #54

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A short presentation of epigenetics.

X.T: [Éric Karsenti] Aux sources de la vie

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Too many interesting subjects (morphogenesis, apparition of life, Tara and the discovery of many new species…), so the speaker cannot give a lot of details, this is frustrating.

X.T: It’s the End of the Gene As We Know It
X.ST: We are not nearly as determined by our genes as once thought.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Our understanding of genes has evolved and we now know that we are far from being fully defined by our DNA.

X.T: Math Reveals the Secrets of Cells’ Feedback Circuitry
X.ST: Maintaining perfect stability through negative feedback is a basic element of electrical circuitry, but it’s been a mystery how cells could do it — until now.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A mathematical proof of an integral control in a live being and a genetically engineered E. Coli.

X.T: L' océan Téthys au Crétacé - (3/3) - Géologie / Paléontologie - Simplex Paléo

ARTICLE.COMMENT: As described by the title, plus the Greater Adria hypothesis.

X.T: [Emmanuelle Pouydebat] Quand les animaux et végétaux nous inspirent, nous, les humains ?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is not a presentation, but some anecdote telling in order to sell some books.

X.T: Denisovans: Our Mysterious Cousins That Made Us Better

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The current knowledge about Denisovans.

X.T: Ce qu'ont vu notre ancêtres, Voyage sur une ligne de vie

ARTICLE.COMMENT: From the first prokaryote up to humans.

X.T: Penelope Boston: Life on Mars? Let's look in the caves
Penelope Boston: Life on Mars? Let's look in the caves

ARTICLE.COMMENT: I wonder why humans, since they thought that a Martian civilisation has dug some channels, are so convinced that there is life on Mars despite all evidence returned by the probes we sent there.

X.T: Exploring Ocean depths and the Undersea Voyager Project.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The first part is about Humboldt Squid and how strange is this animal. The second part describes the Undersea Voyager Project aimed to explore the pelagic zone.

X.T: Bart Weetjens: How I taught rats to sniff out land mines
Bart Weetjens: How I taught rats to sniff out land mines

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Training rats to detect landmines and tuberculosis: a cheap and effective solution for Africa.

X.T: Paul Snelgrove: A census of the ocean
Paul Snelgrove: A census of the ocean

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some discoveries of the ten-year Census of Marine Life, but there is still a lot to discover in the oceans.

X.T: Hadyn Parry: Re-engineering mosquitos to fight disease
Hadyn Parry: Re-engineering mosquitos to fight disease

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Hadyn Parry proposes to genetically modify male mosquitoes so they are sterile, then to scatter them so they met females and these ones do not lay eggs. Of course, he does not speak about the GM issues…

X.T: Something Other Than Adaptation Could Be Driving Evolution

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Researchers have modeled the evolution of greenish warblers, a ring species, and showed that natural selection is not necessary to create new species: this would confirm the "neutral biodiversity" theory.
